rComments: Grading criteria is a little confusing, but as long as you listen to his explanation of the assignments in class, you'll get a gist of what he expects. He's big on meeting outside of class (aka office hours) - be prepared for that.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Participation matters', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Probably the worst prof I've had at UofT. I've never encountered a lecturer who cares this little about his students. Also, his lectures are incredibly boring and unhelpful. Inconsistent marking between essays. Avoid this prof!

Really nice, understanding guy. Lectures are a bit hard to follow & he really emphasizes participation. Tests based mostly on lecture but also reading. Papers are challenging but fair for second year. A lot of easy marks available if you show up and participate. Readings are tough, and lecture doesn't help but concepts are straightforward.
did pretty bad on the first assign, but the prof took me through where i went wrong and how to write a real paper.  tough course but came out feeling like I know more

Lectures were interesting (good content + good lecturer (has an accent though)) and he knows what he's talking about. Readings were quite lengthy and dense but I found that it was okay just to understand the main points and an example or two. The grading felt unfair though, and the essay guidelines seemed vague.

teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read']

rComments: I ended up dropping the class because his accent is too strong. If you're not good with accents, I would not take this class. I have heard from my peers who stayed in the class that his marking was completely unreasonable. If you miss one class that has a participation mark, you loss 3 percent on your final grade.
like his lectures, he knows his stuff and tries to keep it interesting.  Assignments are pretty challenging though

I took this course  over the summer, which was a fair amount of work, but the study guide helped a lot. The prof knows his stuff really well and pushes you to think for yourself, which I personally liked. He has a lot to offer and is super approachable if you have any problems.

Fast talker. Strong accent. Quiet voice. Overall frustrating to sit in class and try to understand him. Material is pretty repetitive each class. Bad lecture slides. He asks a lot of questions trying to start discussions but usually does not answer questions pretty well as he rambles on off topic. The class consisted of 3 essays and 1 final exam
